author: 庞婷
title: BIBF香港馆将展出多项非物质文化遗产_央广网
text:
央广网北京6月12日消息（记者 朱冠安）第三十一届北京国际图书博览会（BIBF）将于6月18日至22日在中国北京国家会议中心举行。本届博览会聚焦国际文化交流，新增网络文学专题展区。
6月11日，记者在2025北京国际图书博览会香港馆发布会上了解到，BIBF香港馆以“漫步香港：非遗与城市记忆”为主题，设立四大专区，集中展示多项香港非物质文化遗产，包括蒸笼、花钮、广彩、粤剧头饰、扎作、港式奶茶等制作技艺及舞火龙，配合相关的香港出版物、印刷品，多元呈现中华优秀文化在香港这座国际都会的传承与创新。
4位香港非遗技艺传承人林嘉裕（蒸笼）、周燕云（粤剧头饰）、许嘉雄（扎作）、谢忠德（港式奶茶）将来到BIBF香港馆，主持8场工作坊，介绍非遗技艺。同时，观众可以通过现场的AR/VR设备身临其境地欣赏香港的大坑舞火龙盛况，感受香港的社区文化，进一步探索香港的文化旅游特色。
BIBF香港馆重点展现“以文塑旅，以旅彰文”的融合发展理念。策展人周婉美在新闻发布会上介绍，非遗已经融入香港大众的日常生活，希望通过这次以香港非遗及城市记忆为主题的展览，展示香港这座城市的“温度、律动、脉动”，推动香港非遗设计的永续发展。
今年BIBF香港馆还在开幕式当日同步上线虚拟版，公众可以通过虚拟BIBF香港馆了解有关展览、展品以及活动的内容。在今年北京国际图书博览会结束后，虚拟BIBF香港馆将持续至2025年底，让读者接触到优秀的香港出版物及印刷品。
编辑:庞婷
更多精彩资讯请在应用市场下载“央广网”客户端。欢迎提供新闻线索，24小时报料热线400-800-0088；消费者也可通过央广网“啄木鸟消费者投诉平台”线上投诉。版权声明：本文章版权归属央广网所有，未经授权不得转载。转载请联系：cnrbanquan@cnr.cn，不尊重原创的行为我们将追究责任。

author: @eleconomista
title: Países del G20 acuerdan impulsar mecanismos financieros contra el cambio climático
text: [Geopolítica](/internacionales) Lectura 3:00 min Países del G20 acuerdan impulsar mecanismos financieros contra el cambio climático La ministra de ambiente brasileña, Marina Silva, afirmó que los países del G20 tienen "una gran responsabilidad" y deben "liderar el enfrentamiento a la crisis climática". Los países del G20 se comprometieron el jueves en Brasil a impulsar mecanismos financieros "innovadores" para enfrentar la [emergencia climática](https://www.eleconomista.com.mx/capital-humano/20-paises-riesgos-crisis-climatica-son-bajos-proteccion-social-oit-20241001-727915.html), en momentos en que una ola de incendios récord azota la Amazonia, la mayor selva tropical del mundo. "Las pérdidas humanas y ambientales en todo el mundo dejan claro la necesidad urgente de tomar mayores medidas para responder a la nueva realidad global", afirma la declaración aprobada por los ministros de medioambiente de las 20 mayores economías del mundo al cierre de una reunión en Rio de Janeiro. "Los impactos del cambio climático ya se están sintiendo en todo el mundo, afectando de manera más severa a las regiones y países vulnerables, con inundaciones sin precedentes, sequías extremas, olas de calor superiores a la media y otros eventos que aún no estamos completamente preparados para enfrentar", agrega el texto. Con 80% de la [población mundial](https://www.eleconomista.com.mx/economia/FMI-y-BM-intensificaran-cooperacion-contra-deuda-y-cambio-climatico-20230907-0138.html), el G20 representa cerca del 80% de las emisiones de carbono y el 75% de la generación de residuos. La ministra de ambiente brasileña, Marina Silva, afirmó que los países del G20 tienen "una gran responsabilidad" y deben "liderar el enfrentamiento a la crisis climática". Brasil, que este año preside el G20, sufrió en mayo los embates de inundaciones históricas en la región sureste, y atraviesa en la actualidad una ola de incendios récord alimentados por sequías también sin precedentes. Estos eventos extremos están favorecidos por el cambio climático, según los expertos. La movilización de recursos financieros para mitigar el calentamiento global ha estado en el centro de las discusiones del G20, que concluirán con la cumbre de jefes de Estado y de gobierno el 18 y 19 de noviembre en Rio. "Para alcanzar estos objetivos, consideraremos herramientas económicas innovadoras, como los pagos por servicios ecosistémicos (...) entre otros, la fertilidad del suelo, el control de la erosión, la polinización y el suministro de agua", dice la declaración. Brasil quiere promover el Fondo Bosques Tropicales para Siempre (TFFF, por sus siglas en inglés), un "complejo" instrumento de inversión que aspira a estar operativo el año próximo, cuando la ciudad brasileña de Belem acoja la COP30 del clima. A mediados de septiembre, los esfuerzos en materia ambiental del G20 fueron puestos en tela de juicio por organizaciones ecologistas, que denunciaron falta de compromiso del grupo para avanzar hacia una transición que elimine el uso de energías fósiles. Las críticas se basaron en un borrador de la declaración sobre el clima que el G20 presentará en Washington tras una reunión ministerial a finales de octubre, en el que se omite mencionar las energías fósiles. "Un comunicado del G20 sin siquiera mencionar la transición fuera de las energías fósiles (...) por parte de las 20 economías más poderosas del planeta, crearía un precedente preocupante", señaló Maria Victoria Emanuelli, de 350.org.

author: Viktor Anokhin
title: Why the West Turns Away From Global South Peace Proposals - 01.02.2024, Sputnik Africa
text: Why the West Turns Away From Global South Peace Proposals [18:41 01.02.2024](/20240201/)(Updated: 17:50 07.02.2024) Subscribe Despite South Africa and Brazil offering peace settlement proposals to the Ukrainian conflict, the West seems to turn a blind eye to them. AfroVerdict host sits down with a Ugandan international relations expert to examine the issue on a deeper level. Back in June 2023, South Africa led an African peace initiative for the settlement of the Russia-Ukraine conflict, which saw no results. Brazil suggested an immediate ceasefire and diplomatic talks…which was also fruitless. So why does the West constantly ignore proposals voiced from the Global South? This problem is a "historical" reflection of "colonialism and imperialism", where the West disregards "anything bright" and "meaningful" from the continent, according to Dr. Anne Abaho, International Relations and Security Studies Lecturer, Nkumba University Uganda. "The historical rejection of the African continent and its peoples, and black people in the diaspora, is simply making a clear return, without holding back to the extent that even in terms of beyond color," Dr. Abaho explains. Efforts made "for purposes of global order", which is in "everyone's interest", are too "rejected". "So they still look at the developing world as it still needs to be civilized. It still needs to be cleaned, it still needs to be taught what is right from wrong and what is left from right," the expert says. The secret lies in a mismatch of interests and a different interpretation of "peace". While countries of the Global South feel "the weight" of the conflict to a larger degree than the West, the latter "is interested in its victory over Russia", rather than a "peace in terms of ceasefires and negotiations and diplomacy". "The initiatives that have been advanced by the African countries do not match the strategies that had been laid by the Western world," Dr. Abaho underscores. To hear what else the expert had to say, check out the entire episode of the AfroVerdict podcast, brought to you by Sputnik Africa. In addition to the website, you can also catch our episodes on [Telegram](https://t.me/sputnik_africa). ► You can also listen to our podcast on [Google Podcasts](https://podcasts.google.com/feed/aHR0cHM6Ly9jbG91ZC5tYXZlLmRpZ2l0YWwvNDYyMTM=), [Apple Podcasts](https://podcasts.apple.com/us/podcast/afroverdict/id1688529180), [Castbox](https://castbox.fm/ch/5434263), [Pocket Casts](https://pca.st/27cbh1w1), [Deezer](https://deezer.com/show/6054537), [Podcast Addict](https://podcastaddict.com/podcast/afroverdict/4434100)and [Afripods](https://afripods.africa/podcaster/podcasts/episodes/by_podcast/3c01b6fc-d17c-4a97-992b-1cfbc46dba51). ► Check out all the episodes of

author: Yeni Şafak
title: Türkiye: 32 suspects, préparant des attentats contre des synagogues, des églises et l'ambassade d'Irak, arrêtés | Actualités Turquie
text:
Selon les informations reçues vendredi de sources de sécurité turques, le MIT a détecté que Mijbel Al-Shuveyhi (nom de code "Abu Yakin Al-Iraqi"), le soi-disant officier de renseignement de la structure turque de l'organisation terroriste Daech, et Muhammed Hilaf Ibrahim Ibrahim (nom de code "Abu Leys"), se préparaient à attaquer des synagogues et des églises en Türkiye, tandis que Iyheb Elani (nom de code "Abdullah Al-Jumaili") se préparait à attaquer l'ambassade d'Irak à Ankara.
DEAŞ Terör Örgütüne yönelik İstanbul merkezli 9️⃣ ilde düzenlenen “KAHRAMANLAR-37” Operasyonunda 2️⃣9️⃣ Şahıs Yakalandı❗
️
Terör Örgütleri ve onların İş Birlikçileriyle mücadelemiz kararlılıkla devam edecek❗
️
❌MİT Başkanlığı ile Emniyet Genel Müdürlüğü İstihbarat Başkanlığı ve… pic.twitter.com/xfu2gbrKT1
— Ali Yerlikaya (@AliYerlikaya) December 29, 2023 Publication du ministre de l'Intérieur turc, Ali Yerlikaya Les trois terroristes et 29 suspects identifiés comme leur étant liés ont été capturés lors d'une opération organisée à l'aube de vendredi dans neuf provinces du pays. De nombreux matériels numériques appartenant à l'organisation terroriste ont également été saisis au cours de l'opération.

author: Mike Wheatley
title: Siemens to buy life sciences R&D company Dotmatics for $5.1B - SiliconANGLE
text:
German industrial giant Siemens AG said today it will pay $5.1 billion to acquire the life sciences data startup Dotmatics in an effort to expand its artificial intelligence offerings.
The company said the deal to acquire Dotmatics, officially known as GraphPad Software LLC, is expected to close in the first half of 2026, according to a report in the Wall Street Journal .
Boston-based Dotmatics was founded in 2005 by the former Merck & Co. scientists Stephen Gallagher and Alastair Hill, and claims that more than two million scientists in 125 countries use its “ Science Intelligence ” platform to digitize lab data, enhance collaboration and analyze their research findings.
Siemens wants to combine Dotmatic’s data applications with its AI, manufacturing and industrial-simulation tools in order to connect development processes from the research and development stage all the way to end manufacturing operations. The acquisition will increase its total addressable market within the industrial software sector by up to $11 billion, it said.
The German company has long been trying to leverage AI to accelerate innovation across industries.
“Artificial intelligence has emerged as a transformative force across various industries and its application in life sciences is increasingly important,” said Siemens Chief Executive Roland Bursch in a statement .
Dotmatics CES Thomas Swalla said the combination of his company’s platform and Siemens AI and digital twin technologies will drive “a new wave of innovation” in life sciences R&D.
Siemens said it intends to finance the deal primarily via the sale of shares in listed companies, such as Siemens Healthineers.
Dotmatics, which is backed by the venture capital firm Insight Partners, anticipates it will generate more than $300 million in revenue during the current fiscal year. According to Siemens, it’s already very profitable, with an earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization or EBITDA margin of more than 40%.
Once the acquisition closes, Siemens says it will see near-term revenue synergies of around $100 million per year, rising to more than $500 million annually over the long term. It will be immediately accretive to the company’s growth, prior to considering any synergies, it added.
Insight Partners first invested in Dotmatics in 2017, and was part of a fund that acquired the company outright in 2021 for around $500 million. In a report last December, Bloomberg said Insight was exploring options for Dotmatics.
“The transition of Dotmatics from Insight Partners to Siemens represents a logical next step, empowering Dotmatics to further advance its mission of accelerating innovation within life sciences,” said Insight Partners Managing Director Jared Rosen in a statement to Bloomberg.
For Siemens, the deal will be the sixth-biggest in its history, out of hundreds of acquisitions it has made over its more than 100-year existence. Last year, it paid $10 billion to buy a company called Altair Engineering Inc., which is its biggest acquisition to date.
Photo: Siemens AG

author: Arlene Divina
title: Ultimate 9 Dog Breeds That Show Us the True Meaning of Family
text:
Shutterstock Dogs have always been celebrated as loyal companions, but some breeds go above and beyond, becoming true pillars of family life. These dogs aren’t just pets—protectors, playmates, and empathetic friends who can sense emotions and offer unwavering support. While popular breeds often steal the spotlight, lesser-known dogs also excel in family settings with their affectionate nature, patience with children, and loyalty to their pack. Whether it’s a well-known gentle giant or an overlooked breed brimming with love, these dogs remind us what family is all about: loyalty, love, and togetherness.
Newfoundland Shutterstock The Newfoundland is often called the “nanny dog” for good reason. With their massive size and kind-hearted demeanor, these gentle giants are natural caretakers, especially around children. Known for their calm nature and incredible patience, they’re often compared to big, furry lifeguards due to their innate swimming skills and rescue instincts. Despite their size, Newfoundlands are incredibly gentle and affectionate, forming deep emotional bonds with their family members. They thrive in homes where they can be a central part of daily life, offering cuddles and comfort whenever needed.
Keeshond Shutterstock With its bright eyes and perpetual smile, the Keeshond is a lesser-known breed that shines in family dynamics. These fluffy companions are known for their cheerful disposition and love of human interaction. Keeshonds are incredibly alert and make excellent watchdogs without being overly aggressive. Their loyalty to their family is unmatched, and they have a unique way of sensing emotions, often snuggling up to a sad family member to provide comfort. Their medium size and adaptability make them a perfect fit for apartments and larger homes.
Leonberger Shutterstock Leonbergers, with their lion-like appearance and gentle nature, are one of the most family-oriented dogs you’ll ever meet. These large, majestic dogs are incredibly patient with children and are known to form deep emotional connections with their humans. Leonbergers are surprisingly gentle and careful around smaller family members despite their size. They excel in being both playful companions and protective guardians, balancing their energy and calmness perfectly. Their affectionate nature and loyalty make them a cherished member of any family they join.
Finnish Lapphund Shutterstock Finnish Lapphunds may not be the most commonly recognized breed, but their loving and gentle personalities make them perfect family dogs. Historically bred to herd reindeer, they have an excellent work ethic and an endearing playfulness. These fluffy dogs are known for being incredibly patient with children and have an almost magical ability to adapt to their family’s energy. Finnish Lapphunds are social animals who thrive on companionship and love spending time with their pack, whether it’s through outdoor adventures or lazy afternoons on the couch.
Staffordshire Bull Terrier Shutterstock Often misunderstood due to their muscular appearance, Staffordshire Bull Terriers are actually incredibly loving and gentle dogs, especially with children. Known affectionately as “nanny dogs,” Staffies are fiercely loyal and protective, forming deep bonds with their families. They have an incredible tolerance for rough play, making them excellent companions for active kids. These dogs thrive on love and attention; their goofy, affectionate personalities will surely win over every family member. Their devotion and protective nature make them true symbols of family loyalty.
Lagotto Romagnolo Shutterstock Known for their curly coats and keen sense of smell, Lagotto Romagnolos are affectionate family companions with a playful side. Originally bred for truffle hunting in Italy, these dogs have an incredible work ethic and a fun-loving spirit. They are highly trainable and intelligent, making it easy to integrate into family life. Their hypoallergenic coat is a bonus for families with allergy concerns. Lagottos are known for their deep emotional connections with their humans and constant desire to please, making them an underrated family gem.
Eurasier Shutterstock The Eurasier is a relatively rare breed, but it shines in family settings thanks to its calm demeanor and deep loyalty. These dogs are neither overly clingy nor aloof—they strike a perfect balance of independence and affection. Eurasiers are known for being exceptionally gentle with children and forming close bonds with their family members. They thrive on routine and consistency, fitting seamlessly into homes that value stability and connection. Their quiet confidence and loving nature make them ideal family dogs.
Icelandic Sheepdog Shutterstock The Icelandic Sheepdog is a bright and energetic breed known for its cheerful personality and boundless loyalty. These dogs are excellent with children and thrive on being included in family activities. Originally bred to herd sheep in the harsh Icelandic terrain, they are resilient, intelligent, and eager to please. Their playful energy and gentle nature make them fantastic companions for active families. They also excel at reading their owner’s emotions, offering comfort and affection when needed most.
Bernese Mountain Dog Shutterstock The Bernese Mountain Dog is well-known for its affectionate and gentle temperament, making it one of the best family dogs around. These large, fluffy companions are patient with children and devoted to their families. Despite their size, Bernese Mountain Dogs are gentle giants who love being part of family adventures, whether it’s hiking in the mountains or lounging by the fireplace. Their calm demeanor and protective instincts make them reliable and loving members of any family.
The Furry Family MVPs Shutterstock From the nurturing Newfoundland to the playful Icelandic Sheepdog, these breeds remind us that family isn’t defined by species—it’s about loyalty, love, and a willingness to be there through thick and thin. Whether they’re fluffy giants like the Leonberger or smaller charmers like the Keeshond, each dog brings something special. They offer protection without aggression, playfulness without chaos, and love without conditions. These dogs aren’t just pets; they’re true family members who remind us daily of the simple joys of togetherness and unwavering companionship.

author: Najla Nur Fauziyah
title: 5.3M Earthquake Hits Garut, Sukabumi This Morning - Sci En.tempo.co
text: 5.3M Earthquake Hits Garut, Sukabumi This Morning Translator Editor 28 December 2023 11:15 WIB TEMPO.CO, Jakarta - The Meteorology, Climatology, and Geophysics Agency or BMKG reported a tectonic [earthquake](https://www.tempo.co/search?waktu=&kanal=&subkanal=&domain=2&q=earthquake) with an updated parameter of 5.3-magnitude hitting the southern part of Garut and Tasikmalaya in West Java on Thursday, Dec. 28, 2023, at around 05:43 a.m. WIB (Western Indonesia Time). The epicenter is located at 8.18 degrees Southern Latitude and 107.79 degrees Longitude East, or 94 kilometers away southwest of Pangandaran Regency at 41-kilometer depth. "Considering the epicenter and the hypocenter, it was a shallow intraplate earthquake," said the head of the earthquake and tsunami center r at BMKG on Thursday. "The [BMKG] analysis result found that the earthquake had an oblique-thrusting fault movement." The earthquake was felt at the scale of IV MMI in Garut. Meaning, the vibration was felt by many people inside the house. In Cilacap, Pelabuhan Ratu, Sukabumi, Cianjur, and Pangandaran, the earthquake was felt at III MMI on the intensity scale while it was felt at the scale of II-III MMI in Bandung and Bogor. BMKG recorded one aftershock up until 06:15 a.m. WIB. The earthquake did not cause any tsunami potential. ERWIN PRIMA Editor's Choice: [Shallow Earthquake Rocks Purwakarta on Christmas Day](https://en.tempo.co/read/1813541/shallow-earthquake-rocks-purwakarta-on-christmas-day) [Click here](https://news.google.com/publications/CAAqBggKMMnVJTCC7gU?hl=en-ID&gl=ID&ceid=ID:en) to get the latest news updates from Tempo on Google News

author: 張之謙
title: 天氣／整天濕冷！冷氣團「影響時間延長」　專家：冰箱門又被打開了│TVBS新聞網
text:
受到大陸 冷氣團 南下影響，今（6）日各地 天氣 轉冷，氣象專家林得恩表示，這波冷氣團影響時間較長，會延長到3/8的上午，最冷時段會落在今晚至明晨，「冰箱門又被打開了！」
中央氣象署表示，今日華南雲雨區東移，臺灣海峽一帶不定時有華南雲系移入，中部以北、花東地區較易降雨，基隆北海岸有局部大雨發生，其他各地有局部短暫陣雨；氣溫方面，隨著大陸冷氣團南下，北部及東北部天氣整天濕冷，白天高溫大約15至17度，中部約20度，花東及南部21至24度，預測中部以北及東北部低溫13、14度，南部及花東16至18度；至於離島氣溫：澎湖14至16度、金門11至15度，馬祖8至10度。
林得恩在臉書粉專「林老師氣象站」發文指出，今日臺灣各地降溫有感，天氣明顯轉冷，評估這波冷氣團影響時間較長，會延長到3/8的上午；最冷時段會落在今晚至明晨，強度維持在大陸冷氣團與強烈大陸冷氣團之間。
 林得恩表示，由於這波冷氣團南下期間，華南雲雨帶也同時正在東移，天氣屬偏濕冷型態；尤其是中部以北、東北部及東部地區降雨最為顯著。根據今晨歐洲EC-AIFS數值模式顯示，在本月中旬（3/15至3/17前後），還會有新一波強冷空氣會南下影響臺灣；不過，由於時間尚久，不確定性大，還可以再追蹤觀察後續的發展。

author: 小浪财讯
title: 科创板人工智能ETF（588930）涨0.18%，半日成交额4981.46万元|科创板_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，科创板 人工智能ETF （588930）涨0.18%，报1.111元，成交额4981.46万元。科创板人工智能ETF（588930）重仓股方面， 澜起科技 截止午盘涨1.02%， 芯原股份 跌2.79%， 金山办公 跌0.69%， 石头科技 跌0.26%， 寒武纪 涨0.31%， 恒玄科技 涨2.03%， 晶晨股份 涨0.31%， 乐鑫科技 涨1.97%， 中科星图 涨3.07%， 复旦微电 涨1.35%。
科创板人工智能ETF（588930）业绩比较基准为 上证科创板人工智能指数 收益率，管理人为银华基金管理股份有限公司，基金经理为谭跃峰，成立（2025-01-06）以来回报为10.83%，近一个月回报为-3.21%。

title: 京东方华灿按下GaN技术加速键-电子工程专辑
text:
插播：天科合达、天岳先进、同光半导体、烁科晶体、泰坦未来、浙江晶瑞、芯聚能、三安半导体、安海半导体、华卓精科、快克芯装备、合盛新材料、京航特碳、恒普技术、奥亿达新材料、创锐光谱、西湖仪器、凌锐半导体、中电化合物、昕感科技、羿变电气、东尼电子、西格玛、铭扬半导体、瑞霏光电等已确认参编《2025碳化硅衬底与外延产业调研白皮书》及《2025碳化硅器件与模块产业调研白皮》，参编咨询请联系许若冰（hangjiashuo999）。
为支撑这一战略并持续提升氮化镓技术竞争力，京东方华灿依托其完善的IDM模式，在多个关键领域取得了显著进展：
·外延方面，京东方华灿基于自主研发的GaN外延结构，器件的横向BV从1400V提升至2000V+，有效提高器件可靠性裕量，并已开启1200V GaN的产品技术储备；
·工艺线方面，流片通量及产品良率持续提高，进一步保障批量出货能力；
·器件方面，除全面进行JEDEC认证外，已启动下一代平台的技术储备；
·测试能力方面，已建立相关实验室，并匹配完善的品质体系。
京东方华灿作为国内氮化镓的重要生力军，围绕下一步的氮化镓技术创新、产能布局、市场推进等方面，他们有何规划？
8月14日，由“行家说三代半”主办的“新型功率半导体与新能源应用高峰论坛”即将在深圳举办，目前，京东方华灿已正式确认出席本次大会。
届时，京东方华灿氮化镓研发总监马欢将带来《京东方华灿氮化镓创新与发展》，分享京东方华灿基于20年氮化镓材料的积累，在氮化镓功率半导体领域的技术探索、产品进展，以及分享对氮化镓的技术理解。欲深入了解京东方华灿的氮化镓创新技术成果，欢迎扫描下方海报二维码报名参会。
8月14日，行家说“新型功率半导体与新能源应用高峰论坛”将在深圳举行，旨在汇聚功率半导体产业链上下游企业代表，共同探讨新型功率半导体在动力系统、新能源等领域的新机遇以及面临的技术挑战与解决方案。
本次大会具备以下四个亮点：
·亮点一：超强嘉宾阵容
除京东方华灿外，大会还邀请了英飞源、三安半导体、英诺赛科、芯干线、聚能创芯、誉鸿锦、快克芯等行业领军及代表企业参与，通过主题分享输出前沿技术经验与市场洞察，共同探索功率半导体产业的新发展。
·亮点二：行业热潮话题
围绕新能源汽车、EV超充、数据中心、机器人等高增速市场话题，大会与众多行业专家探讨新型功率半导体的技术进展与应用落地，深度剖析技术瓶颈与创新路径，为行业发展提供极具价值的新思路与新方案。
·亮点三：两大重磅报告
届时，大会现场将重磅发布《2024-2025 氮化镓（GaN）产业调研白皮书》成果，并以此解读氮化镓产业的竞争态势、市场前景；同时重点分享“人形机器人趋势报告”，助力功率半导体企业把握行业脉搏，抢占发展先机。
·亮点四：GaN圆桌论坛
本次活动将汇聚GaN企业代表，包括英诺赛科副总裁陈钰林、誉鸿锦董事长闫怀宝、聚能创芯总经理袁理等。他们将通过圆桌论坛形式的思想碰撞，共同剖析氮化镓产业的发展现状、产业机遇。
席位有限，先到先得！欢迎各位行家扫码报名参会！8月14日，我们在深圳不见不散。
本文发自【行家说三代半】，专注第三代半导体（碳化硅和氮化镓）行业观察。
